decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Detailed drawings or samples of materials, as appropriate, in respect of the following, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of the work: (a)  new brickwork (including arches), (b)  copings, (c) bonding, (d) mortar mixes, (e) roofing materials (including glazing strip and clay tiles) (f) new doors and windows, including cross section of glazing bars (g) works to restore decorative interior paint work finishes. Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with the drawings as approved.  REASON: To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B21, B22, B24, ES6, H8, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5, 5.9. | Sample panels of the brickwork shall be constructed on site and approval by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to the commencement of works. The brickwork sample panel shall be retained on site until the work is completed in accordance with the  approved panels.  REASON:	To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of the building, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B21, B22, B24, ES6, H8, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8, 5.5, 5.9.
